NAME: Cursor Home
DESCRIPTION: Moves the display cursor to top-left

NAME: Erase EOL
DESCRIPTION: All characters on current line from cursor position to end replaced with spaces

NAME: Restore cursor pos
DESCRIPTION: Return cursor to previously stored row and column

NAME: Clear screen
DESCRIPTION: Same as PRINT CHR$(12) - clear screen and move cursor to top left

NAME: Clear to end of screen
DESCRIPTION: All positions from the current cursor to end of screen are replaced with spaces

NAME: Set cursor position
DESCRIPTION: Move the cursor to row {row} and column {col} (1;1=top left)

NAME: Delete line
DESCRIPTION: Delete the current cursor line and move the display underneath it up one line. Last line of the display then is blank.

NAME: Insert line
DESCRIPTION: Insert a blank line at the current cursor position and move the display below it down one line.

NAME:
Set graphics rendition

Note: Text and background setting reversed if inverse is active.
DESCRIPTION:
Set the active foreground or background text colour. 
If character attributes enabled, all characters that appear after this sequence will use the colour specified. 
If character attributes disabled then the complete screen will be displayed in the colours specified.
One or two parameters can be specified in the same command.
Val.
column5:
PRINT CHR$(27);"[31;44mTHIS IS RED ON BLUE"
PRINT CHR$(27);"[93;42mTHIS IS BRIGHT YELLOW ON GREEN"
PRINT CHR$(27);"[30mTHIS IS BLACK TEXT"
PRINT CHR$(27);"[41mBACKGROUND NOW RED"
will give the following...
THIS IS RED ON BLUE
THIS IS BRIGHT YELLOW ON GREEN
THIS IS BLACK TEXT
BACKGROUND NOW RED
